Connecticut Department of Transportation New Haven Line Fare Increase for Travel from Connecticut Stations Effective January 1

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect for stations on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2018. This is the last of seven consecutive annual fare increases that were previously authorized to fund the purchase of M8 rail cars. The changes will affect ticket prices for travel: Between stations within Connecticut; Between Connecticut and New York stations. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. See full details and fares at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/fare_CTincrease2018.htm

West-of-Hudson New Year's Eve Holiday Service thru Jan. 1

Ring in the New Year with Metro-North! Whether you are heading to Times Square or spending a quiet evening with friends, we've got reliable Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Line service to get you to and from your celebrations: On Saturday, December 30, we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Sunday, January 31, we will operate a Sunday schedule with extra early-morning departures on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines after midnight. On Monday, January 1 we will operate a Weekend/Holiday schedule. See our schedules page, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/linkwest.html for details, or visit www.njtransit.com. All of us at Metro-North wish you a safe and happy holiday season! For more information about the New Year's service, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/woh_holidayservice.htm

Special New Year's Weekend Service thru Monday, Jan 1

Ring in the New Year with Metro-North! Whether you are watching the ball drop on Time's Square or hanging with friends, the best way to get there is with our special New Year's service. On Sun., Dec. 31, our New Year's Eve service includes extra inbound late afternoon and early evening service, and "overnight" New Year's early morning service. Those of you taking our early morning New Year's service will have your tickets collected prior to boarding trains at Grand Central. Buy your train tickets in advance: We suggest you use MTA eTix, the mobile ticketing app http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo . On New Year's Day, Mon., Jan. 1, 2018, we will operate hourly service on most line segments, and regular weekend service on branch lines. For both Sunday and Monday, see our Christmas/ New Year's Holiday timetable for service, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm or our Train Time app, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/traintimeapp.htm **Please remember that drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from noon New Year's Eve until noon New Year's Day. ** All of us at Metro-North wish you a safe and happy New Year! For more information about the New Years service, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/nye_holidayservice.htm

Customers should consider: * Riding at the start or end of peak hours to avoid congestion. * Consider traveling to/from Atlantic Terminal or Hunterspoint Ave. For details on how the Amtrak repairs affect your branch, visit attached link to view branch timetables dated January 8 to February 25, 2018.

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect for stations on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2018. This is the last of seven consecutive annual fare increases that were previously authorized to fund the purchase of M8 rail cars. The changes will affect ticket prices for travel: Between stations within Connecticut; Between Connecticut and New York stations. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. See full details and fares at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/fare_CTincrease2018.htm

Special New Year's Weekend Service (Fri. Dec. 29 - Mon. Jan 1)

Ring in the New Year with Metro-North! Whether you are watching the ball drop on Time's Square or hanging with friends, the best way to get there is with our special New Year's service. On Fri., Dec. 29 when we will operate a reduced weekday AM Peak service, with additional inbound trains. In the afternoon, look for our early getaway service. See a regular Oct. 8 timetable for details , http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm or our Train Time app, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/traintimeapp.htm. On Sun., Dec. 31, our New Year's Eve service includes extra inbound late afternoon and early evening service, and "overnight" New Year's early morning service. Those of you taking our early morning New Year's service will have your tickets collected prior to boarding trains at Grand Central. Buy your train tickets in advance: We suggest you use MTA eTix, the mobile ticketing app http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo . On New Year's Day, Mon., Jan. 1, 2018, we will operate hourly service on most line segments, and regular weekend service on branch lines. For both Sunday and Monday, see our Christmas/ New Year's Holiday timetable for service, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm or our Train Time app, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/traintimeapp.htm **Please remember that drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from noon New Year's Eve until noon New Year's Day. ** All of us at Metro-North wish you a safe and happy New Year! For more information about the New Years service, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/nye_holidayservice.htm

West-of-Hudson New Year's Eve Holiday Service (Dec. 29 - Jan. 1)

Ring in the New Year with Metro-North! Whether you are heading to Times Square or spending a quiet evening with friends, we've got reliable Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Line service to get you to and from your celebrations: On Friday, December 29 we will operate a regular Friday schedule. On Saturday, December 30, we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Sunday, January 31, we will operate a Sunday schedule with extra early-morning departures on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines after midnight. On Monday, January 1 we will operate a Weekend/Holiday schedule. See our schedules page, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/linkwest.html for details, or visit www.njtransit.com. All of us at Metro-North wish you a safe and happy holiday season! For more information about the New Years' service, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/woh_holidayservice.htm

Connecticut Department of Transportation New Haven Line Fare Increase for Travel from Connecticut Stations Effective January 1

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect for stations on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2018. This is the last of seven consecutive annual fare increases that were previously authorized to fund the purchase of M8 rail cars. The changes will affect ticket prices for travel: Between stations within Connecticut; Between Connecticut and New York stations. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. See full details and fares at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/fare_CTincrease2018.htm

Special New Year's Weekend Service (Fri. Dec. 29 - Mon. Jan 1)

Ring in the New Year with Metro-North! Whether you are watching the ball drop on Time's Square or hanging with friends, the best way to get there is with our special New Year's service. On Fri., Dec. 29 when we will operate a reduced weekday AM Peak service, with additional inbound trains. In the afternoon, look for our early getaway service. See our regular timetable, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm , or our Train Time app, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/traintimeapp.htm , for details. On Sun., Dec. 31, our New Year's Eve service includes extra inbound late afternoon and early evening service, and "overnight" New Year's early morning service. Those of you taking our early morning New Year's service will have your tickets collected prior to boarding trains at Grand Central. Buy your train tickets in advance: We suggest you use MTA eTix, the mobile ticketing app http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo . On New Year's Day, Mon., Jan. 1, 2018, we will operate hourly service on most line segments, and regular weekend service on branch lines. For both Sunday and Monday, see our Christmas/ New Year's Holiday timetable for service, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm or our Train Time app, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/traintimeapp.htm **Please remember that drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from noon New Year's Eve until noon New Year's Day. ** All of us at Metro-North wish you a safe and happy New Year! For more information about the New Years service, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/nye_holidayservice.htm

Connecticut Department of Transportation New Haven Line Fare Increase for Travel from Connecticut Stations Effective January 1

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect for stations on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2018. This is the last of seven consecutive annual fare increases that were previously authorized to fund the purchase of M8 rail cars. The changes will affect ticket prices for travel: Between stations within Connecticut; Between Connecticut and New York stations. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. See full details and fares at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/fare_CTincrease2018.htm

Special New Year's Weekend Service (Fri. Dec. 29 - Mon. Jan 1)

Ring in the New Year with Metro-North! Whether you are watching the ball drop on Time's Square or hanging with friends, the best way to get there is with our special New Year's service. On Fri., Dec. 29 when we will operate a reduced weekday AM Peak service, with additional inbound trains. In the afternoon, look for our early getaway service. See a regular Oct. 8 timetable for details , http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm or our Train Time app, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/traintimeapp.htm. On Sun., Dec. 31, our New Year's Eve service includes extra inbound late afternoon and early evening service, and "overnight" New Year's early morning service. Those of you taking our early morning New Year's service will have your tickets collected prior to boarding trains at Grand Central. Buy your train tickets in advance: We suggest you use MTA eTix, the mobile ticketing app http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo . On New Year's Day, Mon., Jan. 1, 2018, we will operate hourly service on most line segments, and regular weekend service on branch lines. For both Sunday and Monday, see our Christmas/ New Year's Holiday timetable for service, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm or our Train Time app, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/traintimeapp.htm **Please remember that drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from noon New Year's Eve until noon New Year's Day. ** All of us at Metro-North wish you a safe and happy New Year! For more information about the New Year's service, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/nye_holidayservice.htm

Monday, January 1 New Year's Day Subways operate on a Sunday schedule. No 2 service in Brooklyn; trains run between South Ferry and the Bronx. No 3 service in Brooklyn; trains run between 14 St and Harlem-148 St. 4 service runs between Woodlawn and New Lots Av. 5 service runs between Flatbush Av and the Bronx. No 5 or D express service in the Bronx. No 6/7 express service. No B service - use the A/C/D and/or Q instead. M service runs between Delancey-Essex Sts and Broadway Junction A/C/J/L, and between Myrtle-Wyckoff Avs and Metropolitan Av. No W service - use the N/Q or R. No J/Z skip-stop service - take the J instead.

West-of-Hudson New Year's Eve Holiday Service (Dec. 29 - Jan. 1)

Ring in the New Year with Metro-North! Whether you are heading to Times Square or spending a quiet evening with friends, we've got reliable Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Line service to get you to and from your celebrations: On Friday, December 29 we will operate a regular Friday schedule. On Saturday, December 30, we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Sunday, January 31, we will operate a Sunday schedule with extra early-morning departures on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines after midnight. On Monday, January 1 we will operate a Weekend/Holiday schedule. See our schedules page, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/linkwest.html for details, or visit www.njtransit.com. All of us at Metro-North wish you a safe and happy holiday season! For more information about the New Years' service, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/woh_holidayservice.htm

Special New Year's Weekend Service (Fri. Dec. 29 - Mon. Jan 1)

Ring in the New Year with Metro-North! Whether you are watching the ball drop on Time's Square or hanging with friends, the best way to get there is with our special New Year's service. On Fri., Dec. 29 when we will operate a reduced weekday AM Peak service, with additional inbound trains. In the afternoon, look for our early getaway service. See a regular Oct. 8 timetable for details , http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm or our Train Time app, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/traintimeapp.htm. On Sun., Dec. 31, our New Year's Eve service includes extra inbound late afternoon and early evening service, and "overnight" New Year's early morning service. Those of you taking our early morning New Year's service will have your tickets collected prior to boarding trains at Grand Central. Buy your train tickets in advance: We suggest you use MTA eTix, the mobile ticketing app http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo . On New Year's Day, Mon., Jan. 1, 2018, we will operate hourly service on most line segments, and regular weekend service on branch lines. For both Sunday and Monday, see our Christmas/ New Year's Holiday timetable for service, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm or our Train Time app, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/traintimeapp.htm **Please remember that drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from noon New Year's Eve until noon New Year's Day. ** All of us at Metro-North wish you a safe and happy New Year! For more information about the New Year's service, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/nye_holidayservice.htm

Connecticut Department of Transportation New Haven Line Fare Increase for Travel from Connecticut Stations Effective January 1

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect for stations on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2018. This is the last of seven consecutive annual fare increases that were previously authorized to fund the purchase of M8 rail cars. The changes will affect ticket prices for travel: Between stations within Connecticut; Between Connecticut and New York stations. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. See full details and fares at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/fare_CTincrease2018.htm

Connecticut Department of Transportation New Haven Line Fare Increase for Travel from Connecticut Stations Effective January 1

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect for stations on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2018. This is the last of seven consecutive annual fare increases that were previously authorized to fund the purchase of M8 rail cars. The changes will affect ticket prices for travel: Between stations within Connecticut; Between Connecticut and New York stations. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. See full details and fares at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/fare_CTincrease2018.htm

Connecticut Department of Transportation New Haven Line Fare Increase for Travel from Connecticut Stations Effective January 1

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect for stations on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2018. This is the last of seven consecutive annual fare increases that were previously authorized to fund the purchase of M8 rail cars. The changes will affect ticket prices for travel: Between stations within Connecticut; Between Connecticut and New York stations. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. See full details and fares at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/fare_CTincrease2018.htm

Forget the One-Horse Open Sleigh! Metro-North is the best way to get around during this holiday season. On Christmas Day, Monday, December 25, we will operate a special holiday schedule with hourly service on most line segments, and regular weekend service on all branch lines. See our Christmas Holiday Schedule for details, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm For the week between Christmas and New Year's (Tuesday-Thursday, December 26-28), we will operate a weekday schedule with reduced AM Peak service and additional inbound service operating in the late morning. PM peak service will operate normally. See a regular (Oct. 8) timetable for details. See full details about our holiday service, including New Year's Eve and New Year's Day, at http://ow.ly/DT4030h9xCN Schedules are also available via our TrainTime app, http://ow.ly/mK0m30hcKgG On every day during the holidays, you can make your trip easier and faster by using MTA eTix to buy your tickets in advance. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo for more info. All of us at Metro-North wish you a safe and happy holiday season!

Connecticut Department of Transportation New Haven Line Fare Increase for Travel from Connecticut Stations Effective January 1

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect for stations on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2018. This is the last of seven consecutive annual fare increases that were previously authorized to fund the purchase of M8 rail cars. The changes will affect ticket prices for travel: Between stations within Connecticut; Between Connecticut and New York stations. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. See full details and fares at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/fare_CTincrease2018.htm

Forget the One-Horse Open Sleigh! Metro-North is the best way to get around during this holiday season. - On Christmas Eve (Sunday, December 24) we will operate a regular Sunday schedule, with additional Shoppers Specials. See a regular Oct. 8 timetable for details. - On Christmas Day, Monday, December 25, we will operate a special holiday schedule with hourly service on most line segments, and regular weekend service on all branch lines. See our Christmas Holiday Schedule for details, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm - For the week between Christmas and New Year's (Tuesday-Thursday, December 26-28), we will operate a weekday schedule with reduced AM Peak service and additional inbound service operating in the late morning. PM peak service will operate normally. See a regular (Oct. 8) timetable for details, See full details about our holiday service, including New Year's Eve and New Year's Day, at http://ow.ly/DT4030h9xCN Schedules are also available via our TrainTime app, http://ow.ly/mK0m30hcKgG On every day during the holidays, you can make your trip easier and faster by using MTA eTix to buy your tickets in advance. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo for more info. All of us at Metro-North wish you a safe and happy holiday season!

Connecticut Department of Transportation New Haven Line Fare Increase for Travel from Connecticut Stations Effective January 1

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect for stations on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2018. This is the last of seven consecutive annual fare increases that were previously authorized to fund the purchase of M8 rail cars. The changes will affect ticket prices for travel: Between stations within Connecticut; Between Connecticut and New York stations. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. See full details and fares at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/fare_CTincrease2018.htm

Forget the One-Horse Open Sleigh! Metro-North is the best way to get around during this holiday season. On Friday, December 22, we are providing an early Getaway service, with extra trains departing Grand Central beginning at 1 PM. Some evening trains will be cancelled or combined. See a regular Oct. 8 timetable details. http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm On Christmas Eve (Sunday, December 24) we will operate a regular Sunday schedule, with additional Shoppers Specials. See a regular Oct. 8 timetable for details. On Christmas Day, Monday, December 25, we will operate a special holiday schedule with hourly service on most line segments, and regular weekend service on all branch lines. See our Christmas Holiday Schedule for details, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm For the week between Christmas and New Year's (Tuesday-Thursday, December 26-28), we will operate a weekday schedule with reduced AM Peak service and additional inbound service operating in the late morning. PM peak service will operate normally. See a regular (Oct. 8) timetable for details, See full details about our holiday service, including New Year's Eve and New Year's Day, at http://ow.ly/DT4030h9xCN Schedules are also available via our TrainTime app, http://ow.ly/mK0m30hcKgG On every day during the holidays, you can make your trip easier and faster by using MTA eTix to buy your tickets in advance. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo for more info. All of us at Metro-North wish you a safe and happy holiday season!

Forget the One-Horse Open Sleigh! Metro-North is the best way to get around during this holiday season. On Friday, December 22, we are providing an early Getaway service, with extra trains departing Grand Central beginning at 1 PM. Some evening trains will be cancelled or combined. See a regular Oct. 8 timetable details. http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm On Christmas Eve (Sunday, December 24) we will operate a regular Sunday schedule, with additional Shoppers Specials. See a regular Oct. 8 timetable for details. On Christmas Day, Monday, December 25, we will operate a special holiday schedule with hourly service on most line segments, and regular weekend service on all branch lines. See our Christmas Holiday Schedule for details, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm For the week between Christmas and New Year's (Tuesday-Thursday, December 26-28), we will operate a weekday schedule with reduced AM Peak service and additional inbound service operating in the late morning. PM peak service will operate normally. See a regular (Oct. 8) timetable for details, See full details about our holiday service, including New Year's Eve and New Year's Day, at http://ow.ly/DT4030h9xCN Schedules are also available via our TrainTime app, http://ow.ly/mK0m30hcKgG On every day during the holidays, you can make your trip easier and faster by using MTA eTix to buy your tickets in advance. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo for more info. All of us at Metro-North wish you a safe and happy holiday season!

Connecticut Department of Transportation New Haven Line Fare Increase for Travel from Connecticut Stations Effective January 1

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect for stations on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2018. This is the last of seven consecutive annual fare increases that were previously authorized to fund the purchase of M8 rail cars. The changes will affect ticket prices for travel: Between stations within Connecticut; Between Connecticut and New York stations. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. See full details and fares at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/fare_CTincrease2018.htm

On Christmas Eve (Sunday, December 24) we will operate a regular Sunday schedule. On Christmas Day, Monday, December 25, we will operate a regular Weekend/Holiday schedule. For the week between Christmas and New Year's (Tuesday-Thursday, December 26-28), we will operate a weekday schedule. See full details about our holiday service, including New Year's Eve and New Year's Day, at http://ow.ly/GvK330h9xST All of us at Metro-North wish you a safe and happy holiday season!

Forget the One-Horse Open Sleigh! Metro-North is the best way to get around during this holiday season. On Friday, December 22, we are providing an early Getaway service, with extra trains departing Grand Central beginning at 1 PM. Some evening trains will be cancelled or combined. See a regular Oct. 8 timetable details. http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm On Christmas Eve (Sunday, December 24) we will operate a regular Sunday schedule, with additional Shoppers Specials. See a regular Oct. 8 timetable for details. On Christmas Day, Monday, December 25, we will operate a special holiday schedule with hourly service on most line segments, and regular weekend service on all branch lines. See our Christmas Holiday Schedule for details, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm For the week between Christmas and New Year's (Tuesday-Thursday, December 26-28), we will operate a weekday schedule with reduced AM Peak service and additional inbound service operating in the late morning. PM peak service will operate normally. See a regular (Oct. 8) timetable for details, See full details about our holiday service, including New Year's Eve and New Year's Day, at http://ow.ly/DT4030h9xCN Schedules are also available via our TrainTime app, http://ow.ly/mK0m30hcKgG On every day during the holidays, you can make your trip easier and faster by using MTA eTix to buy your tickets in advance. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo for more info. All of us at Metro-North wish you a safe and happy holiday season!

Forget the One-Horse Open Sleigh! Metro-North is the best way to get around during this holiday season. On Friday, December 22, we are providing an early Getaway service, with extra trains departing Grand Central beginning at 1 PM. Some evening trains will be cancelled or combined. See a regular Oct. 8 timetable details. http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm On Christmas Eve (Sunday, December 24) we will operate a regular Sunday schedule, with additional Shoppers Specials. See a regular Oct. 8 timetable for details. On Christmas Day, Monday, December 25, we will operate a special holiday schedule with hourly service on most line segments, and regular weekend service on all branch lines. See our Christmas Holiday Schedule for details, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm For the week between Christmas and New Year's (Tuesday-Thursday, December 26-28), we will operate a weekday schedule with reduced AM Peak service and additional inbound service operating in the late morning. PM peak service will operate normally. See a regular (Oct. 8) timetable for details, See full details about our holiday service, including New Year's Eve and New Year's Day, at http://ow.ly/DT4030h9xCN Schedules are also available via our TrainTime app, http://ow.ly/mK0m30hcKgG On every day during the holidays, you can make your trip easier and faster by using MTA eTix to buy your tickets in advance. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo for more info. All of us at Metro-North wish you a safe and happy holiday season!

Connecticut Department of Transportation New Haven Line Fare Increase for Travel from Connecticut Stations Effective January 1

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect for stations on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2018. This is the last of seven consecutive annual fare increases that were previously authorized to fund the purchase of M8 rail cars. The changes will affect ticket prices for travel: Between stations within Connecticut; Between Connecticut and New York stations. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. See full details and fares at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/fare_CTincrease2018.htm

Connecticut Department of Transportation New Haven Line Fare Increase for Travel from Connecticut Stations Effective January 1

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect for stations on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2018. This is the last of seven consecutive annual fare increases that were previously authorized to fund the purchase of M8 rail cars. The changes will affect ticket prices for travel: Between stations within Connecticut; Between Connecticut and New York stations. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. See full details and fares at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/fare_CTincrease2018.htm

Connecticut Department of Transportation New Haven Line Fare Increase for Travel from Connecticut Stations Effective January 1

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect for stations on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2018. This is the last of seven consecutive annual fare increases that were previously authorized to fund the purchase of M8 rail cars. The changes will affect ticket prices for travel: Between stations within Connecticut; Between Connecticut and New York stations. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. See full details and fares at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/fare_CTincrease2018.htm

The Q35 will detour non-stop via the Cross Bay Veterans Memorial Bridge. Q35 service will be suspended at all Q35 bus stops on Flatbush Av between Troy Av/Quentin Rd and Floyd Bennett Field. B41 buses provide alternate service along Flatbush Av between Avenue H and Kings Plaza/Avenue U. The Q35 will serve the regular bus stops on Avenue H at Flatbush Av, on Flatbush Av at Kings Hwy, and all bus stops in the Rockaways.

Bablyon Br. Wantagh Eastbound Train Canceled

The 6:05PM train from Penn due Wantagh at 6:51PM is canceled due to car shortages caused by a seasonal problem called "Slippery Rail". Customers will be accommodated by the 6:10PM train from Penn due Freeport at 6:54PM, making all combined stops. Slippery rail occurs when fallen leaves deposit a slippery residue on the rails that causes train wheels to skid & develop flat spots. Cars with flat wheels are taken out of service for repair & returned to service as soon as possible. See how the LIRR combats slippery rail at: http://web.mta.info/lirr/Video/SlipperyRail/

Babylon Br. Seaford E/B Train Canceled

The 5:40PM train from Penn due Seaford at 6:30PM is canceled due to car shortages caused by a seasonal problem called "Slippery Rail". Customers will be accommodated by the 5:47PM train from Penn due Freeport at 6:31PM, making all combined stops. Slippery rail occurs when fallen leaves deposit a slippery residue on the rails that causes train wheels to skid & develop flat spots. Cars with flat wheels are taken out of service for repair & returned to service as soon as possible. See how the LIRR combats slippery rail at: http://web.mta.info/lirr/Video/SlipperyRail/

Babylon Br.: Freeport W/B Train Canceled

The 7:29AM train from Freeport due Penn at 8:13AM is canceled due to car shortages caused by a seasonal problem called "Slippery Rail". Customers will be accommodated by the 7:26AM from Wantagh due Penn 8:16AM. Slippery rail occurs when fallen leaves deposit a slippery residue on the rails that causes train wheels to skid & develop flat spots. Cars with flat wheels are taken out of service for repair & returned to service as soon as possible. See how the LIRR combats slippery rail at: http://web.mta.info/lirr/Video/SlipperyRail/

Bablyon Br. Wantagh Eastbound Train Canceled

The 6:05PM train from Penn due Wantagh at 6:51PM is canceled due to car shortages caused by a seasonal problem called "Slippery Rail". Customers will be accommodated by the 6:10PM train from Penn due Freeport at 6:54PM, making all combined stops. Slippery rail occurs when fallen leaves deposit a slippery residue on the rails that causes train wheels to skid & develop flat spots. Cars with flat wheels are taken out of service for repair & returned to service as soon as possible. See how the LIRR combats slippery rail at: http://web.mta.info/lirr/Video/SlipperyRail/

Port Washington Br.: Great Neck E/B Train Canceled

The 5:50PM train from Penn due Great Neck at 6:19PM is cancelled due to car shortages caused by a seasonal problem called "Slippery Rail". Customers will be accommodated by the 5:56PM train from Penn due Great Neck at 6:31PM. Slippery rail occurs when fallen leaves deposit a slippery residue on the rails that causes train wheels to skid & develop flat spots. Cars with flat wheels are taken out of service for repair & returned to service as soon as possible. See how the LIRR combats slippery rail at: http://web.mta.info/lirr/Video/SlipperyRail/

Babylon Br.: Freeport W/B Train Canceled

The 7:29AM train from Freeport due Penn at 8:13AM is cancelled due to car shortages caused by a seasonal problem called "Slippery Rail". Customers will be accommodated by the 7:26AM from Wantagh due Penn 8:16AM. Slippery rail occurs when fallen leaves deposit a slippery residue on the rails that causes train wheels to skid & develop flat spots. Cars with flat wheels are taken out of service for repair & returned to service as soon as possible. See how the LIRR combats slippery rail at: http://web.mta.info/lirr/Video/SlipperyRail/

SantaCon Alert: Alcohol banned on Metro-North trains & at stations from noon Dec. 9 - noon Dec. 10

To maintain orderly travel and safe station and terminal operations during this weekend's SantaCon event, alcohol will not be permitted on Metro-North trains and in stations from noon on Saturday, December 9 through noon on Sunday, December 10. MTA police officers will be on duty at Grand Central Terminal and stations throughout the region, as well as on trains to enforce this restriction. The police will confiscate alcoholic beverages and issue summonses carrying fines or imprisonment. Violators may also be subject to removal from the train or station by police. See more details at http://ow.ly/dI2Z30h3qpu

Expect Some Delays & Cancellations due to Slippery Rail Conditions

Customers are advised to expect more crowded trains and some cancellations this week due to car shortages caused by a seasonal problem called "Slippery Rail". It occurs when fallen leaves deposit a slippery residue on the rails that causes train wheels to skid & develop flat spots. Cars with flat wheels are taken out of service for repair & returned to service as soon as possible. See how the LIRR combats slippery rail at: http://web.mta.info/lirr/Video/SlipperyRail/

SantaCon Alert: Alcohol banned on Metro-North trains & at stations from noon Dec. 9 - noon Dec. 10

To maintain orderly travel and safe station and terminal operations during this weekend's SantaCon event, alcohol will not be permitted on Metro-North trains and in stations from noon on Saturday, December 9 through noon on Sunday, December 10. MTA police officers will be on duty at Grand Central Terminal and stations throughout the region, as well as on trains to enforce this restriction. The police will confiscate alcoholic beverages and issue summonses carrying fines or imprisonment. Violators may also be subject to removal from the train or station by police. See more details at http://ow.ly/dI2Z30h3qpu

To maintain orderly travel and safe station and terminal operations during this weekend's SantaCon event, alcohol will not be permitted on Metro-North trains and in stations from noon on Saturday, December 9 through noon on Sunday, December 10. Expect Some Delays & Cancellations due to Slippery Rail Conditions

Customers are advised to expect more crowded trains and some cancellations this week due to car shortages caused by a seasonal problem called "Slippery Rail". It occurs when fallen leaves deposit a slippery residue on the rails that causes train wheels to skid & develop flat spots. Cars with flat wheels are taken out of service for repair & returned to service as soon as possible. See how the LIRR combats slippery rail at: http://web.mta.info/lirr/Video/SlipperyRail/

SantaCon Alert: Alcohol banned on Metro-North trains & at stations from noon Dec. 9 - noon Dec. 10

To maintain orderly travel and safe station and terminal operations during this weekend's SantaCon event, alcohol will not be permitted on Metro-North trains and in stations from noon on Saturday, December 9 through noon on Sunday, December 10. MTA police officers will be on duty at Grand Central Terminal and stations throughout the region, as well as on trains to enforce this restriction. The police will confiscate alcoholic beverages and issue summonses carrying fines or imprisonment. Violators may also be subject to removal from the train or station by police. See more details at http://ow.ly/dI2Z30h3qpu

Expect Some Delays & Cancellations due to Slippery Rail Conditions

Customers are advised to expect more crowded trains and some cancellations this week due to car shortages caused by a seasonal problem called "Slippery Rail". It occurs when fallen leaves deposit a slippery residue on the rails that causes train wheels to skid & develop flat spots. Cars with flat wheels are taken out of service for repair & returned to service as soon as possible. See how the LIRR combats slippery rail at: http://web.mta.info/lirr/Video/SlipperyRail/

An Explanation for the Crowded Conditions & Delays You are Experiencing this Week on Metro-North

Customers should anticipate shorter trains than normal this week, with the potential for crowded conditions and delays. The extended period of light drizzly rain yesterday (December 5), coupled with the ongoing late-season fall of leaves created extremely slippery rail conditions, which resulted in damage to train wheels during braking. Cars with wheels that are damaged beyond FRA Safety Limits must be removed from service, resulting in a short-term reduction in the number of available rail cars. See full details at http://web.mta.info/supplemental/mnr/mnr_weather_info.html Our equipment maintenance forces will be busy throughout the week working to build back our fleet sizes to full strength. Extra personnel will be on the main floor of Grand Central Terminal to assist with customer information, and will continue extra staffing until the situation is resolved. Thank you for your patience as we work to resolve these issues.
